//IMG//
Refer to the exhibit. An engineer is configuring a new router on the network and applied this configuration. Which additional configuration allows the PC to obtain its IP address from a DHCP server?

choices.D: Configure the ip dhcp smart-relay command globally on the router.
choices.B: Configure the ip dhcp relay information command under interface Gi0/1
choices.A: Configure the ip helper-address 172.16.2.2 command under interface Gi0/0.
choices.C: Configure the ip address dhcp command under interface Gi0/0

discussion.content:
The correct answer is A. **Configure the ip helper-address 172.16.2.2 command under interface Gi0/0.**

When a router is acting as an intermediary between a DHCP client (such as a PC) and a DHCP server, the `ip helper-address` command is used to forward DHCP requests from clients in one subnet to a DHCP server in another subnet. This command is configured on the interface that is in the same subnet as the DHCP clients.

In this case, configuring `ip helper-address 172.16.2.2` under interface Gi0/0 will allow the router to forward DHCP requests from the PC to the DHCP server at the specified IP address (172.16.2.2). This is a common practice when DHCP servers are located on a different subnet than the DHCP clients.

Selected Answer: A

Task 3 -> You advertised Loopback0, but the question asked for Loopback1.

Task 4 -> You're making the interfaces passive, which will disable all OSPF adjacencies on the segment. However the question asks us to "disable their ability to add other OSPF routers". Other than that it looks good.
